titleStmt.title: George W. Doane to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2542

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Louisville August 28th 1861
To his Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

I do hereby respectfully resign the office of magistrate in the first magisterial District in the City of Louisville and would recommend the appointment of Conrad Shroeder an old and respectable Citizen and well qualified for the office

I am well acquainted with captain Shroeder & cheerfully Join in recommending him for the place of Justice of the peace in place ^room^ of Geo W. Doane resigned. Captn Shroeder is well quallified to discharge the duties of the office this appointment would give Satisfaction to the people of the District

M. Pyles
Caleb W Logan
Nat Wolfe
I am not a resident of the District in which the vacancy has occured.
I am well acquainted with Capt Shroeder and believe him qualified for the position asked for by his friends.

Jefferson Co
J. P.
1st Dist
City of Louisv
Louisville
Issd. Aug 30. 1861
